title: Bread of Life
shortSummary: John chapter 6 recounts Jesus' miraculous feeding of the five thousand, His walking on water, and His profound teaching about being the true bread of life. This chapter reveals Jesus as the source of eternal life and challenges believers to trust in Him fully. It also highlights the cost of discipleship as some followers turn away.
timeline: c. AD 30 - Ministry of Jesus in Galilee, shortly before the Passover

keyCharacters.name: Jesus
keyCharacters.description: The Son of God who performs miracles, teaches about eternal life, and reveals Himself as the bread of life.

keyCharacters.name: Philip
keyCharacters.description: One of Jesus’ disciples, asked by Jesus about feeding the crowd, demonstrating human limitation before the miracle.

keyCharacters.name: Andrew
keyCharacters.description: Disciple and brother of Simon Peter, who brings the boy with five barley loaves and two fishes to Jesus.

keyCharacters.name: Simon Peter
keyCharacters.description: One of Jesus’ closest disciples, present during the feeding and later affirms faith in Jesus as the Christ.

keyCharacters.name: Judas Iscariot
keyCharacters.description: One of the twelve disciples, mentioned as the one who would betray Jesus.

definitions.definition: A major Jewish feast commemorating Israel's deliverance from Egypt, marking the time of Jesus’ ministry in this chapter.
Simple, common bread made from barley, symbolizing humble provision used in the feeding miracle.
A title Jesus uses for Himself, indicating that He is the spiritual sustenance that gives eternal life.
A sum of money (two hundred pence) representing a large amount, used to illustrate the insufficiency of human resources.
To complain or grumble quietly, here referring to the Jews’ skepticism and unbelief regarding Jesus’ claims.

outline.heading: Jesus Feeds the Five Thousand
outline.description: Jesus miraculously feeds a large crowd with five barley loaves and two fishes, demonstrating His divine provision and compassion.

outline.heading: Jesus Walks on Water
outline.description: Jesus walks on the sea to His disciples during a storm, revealing His authority over nature and encouraging faith amid fear.

outline.heading: The Crowd Seeks Jesus
outline.description: The people pursue Jesus for physical bread rather than spiritual truth, prompting Jesus to teach about seeking eternal life.

outline.heading: Jesus Declares Himself the Bread of Life
outline.description: Jesus explains that He is the true bread from heaven, offering eternal life to all who believe in Him, contrasting with the manna eaten by their ancestors.

outline.heading: Controversy Over Jesus’ Teaching
outline.description: Jesus speaks about eating His flesh and drinking His blood, a difficult teaching that causes many disciples to question and leave.

outline.heading: The Cost of Discipleship
outline.description: Many disciples abandon Jesus due to His hard sayings, but Peter affirms faith in Jesus as the Christ, while Jesus predicts Judas’ betrayal.

application: Trust in Jesus as the true source of spiritual nourishment and eternal life, not merely physical provision.
Have faith in Jesus’ power and presence during life’s storms, knowing He is sovereign over all circumstances.
Commit to believing in Jesus fully, even when His teachings are challenging or difficult to understand.
Recognize the cost of following Christ and remain steadfast in faith, relying on His promises of eternal life.

keyVerses.text: And Jesus said unto them, I am the bread of life: he that cometh to me shall never hunger; and he that believeth on me shall never thirst.
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals Jesus as the essential spiritual sustenance for eternal life.

keyVerses.text: And this is the will of him that sent me, that every one which seeth the Son, and believeth on him, may have everlasting life: and I will raise him up at the last day.
keyVerses.significance: It emphasizes God’s will for salvation through faith in Jesus and the promise of resurrection.

keyVerses.text: Then Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except ye eat the flesh of the Son of man, and drink his blood, ye have no life in you.
keyVerses.significance: This challenging teaching points to the necessity of intimate union with Christ for spiritual life.

keyVerses.text: Then Simon Peter answered him, Lord, to whom shall we go? thou hast the words of eternal life.
keyVerses.significance: Peter’s confession affirms Jesus as the only source of eternal life and the foundation of true faith.
